00029 /*
00030  * Types traits
00031  */
00032 
00033 template <typename T>
00034 struct trait_trivial_ctor {
00035     enum {
00036         value = false
00037     };
00038 };
00039 
00040 template <typename T>
00041 struct trait_trivial_dtor {
00042     enum {
00043         value = false
00044     };
00045 };
00046 
00047 template <typename T>
00048 struct trait_trivial_copy {
00049     enum {
00050         value = false
00051     };
00052 };
00053 
00054 template <typename T>
00055 struct trait_trivial_move {
00056     enum {
00057         value = false
00058     };
00059 };
00060 
00061 template <typename T>
00062 struct trait_pointer {
00063     enum {
00064         value = false
00065     };
00066 };
00067 
00068 template <typename T>
00069 struct trait_pointer<T*> {
00070     enum {
00071         value = true
00072     };
00073 };
00074 
00075 // sp<> can be trivially moved
00076 template <typename T> class sp;
00077 template <typename T> struct trait_trivial_move< sp<T> > {
00078     enum { value = true };
00079 };
00080 
00081 // wp<> can be trivially moved
00082 template <typename T> class wp;
00083 template <typename T> struct trait_trivial_move< wp<T> > {
00084     enum { value = true };
00085 };
00086 
00087 template <typename TYPE>
00088 struct traits {
00089     enum {
00090         // whether this type is a pointer
00091         is_pointer          = trait_pointer<TYPE>::value,
00092         // whether this type's constructor is a no-op
00093         has_trivial_ctor    = is_pointer || trait_trivial_ctor<TYPE>::value,
00094         // whether this type's destructor is a no-op
00095         has_trivial_dtor    = is_pointer || trait_trivial_dtor<TYPE>::value,
00096         // whether this type type can be copy-constructed with memcpy
00097         has_trivial_copy    = is_pointer || trait_trivial_copy<TYPE>::value,
00098         // whether this type can be moved with memmove
00099         has_trivial_move    = is_pointer || trait_trivial_move<TYPE>::value
00100     };
00101 };
00102 
00103 template <typename T, typename U>
00104 struct aggregate_traits {
00105     enum {
00106         is_pointer          = false,
00107         has_trivial_ctor    =
00108             traits<T>::has_trivial_ctor && traits<U>::has_trivial_ctor,
00109         has_trivial_dtor    =
00110             traits<T>::has_trivial_dtor && traits<U>::has_trivial_dtor,
00111         has_trivial_copy    =
00112             traits<T>::has_trivial_copy && traits<U>::has_trivial_copy,
00113         has_trivial_move    =
00114             traits<T>::has_trivial_move && traits<U>::has_trivial_move
00115     };
00116 };
00117 
00118 #define GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(T)                                       \
00119     template<> struct trait_trivial_ctor< T > { \
00120         enum { value = true }; \
00121     }; \
00122     template<> struct trait_trivial_dtor< T > { \
00123         enum { value = true }; \
00124     }; \
00125     template<> struct trait_trivial_copy< T > { \
00126         enum { value = true }; \
00127     }; \
00128     template<> struct trait_trivial_move< T > { \
00129         enum { value = true }; \
00130     };

00135  * basic types traits
00136  */
00137 
00138 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(void)     // NOLINT
00139 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(bool)     // NOLINT
00140 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(char)     // NOLINT
00141 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(uint8_t)  // NOLINT
00142 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(int16_t)  // NOLINT
00143 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(uint16_t) // NOLINT
00144 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(int32_t)  // NOLINT
00145 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(uint32_t) // NOLINT
00146 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(int64_t)  // NOLINT
00147 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(uint64_t) // NOLINT
00148 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(float)    // NOLINT
00149 GAIA_BASIC_TYPES_TRAITS(double)   // NOLINT

00154 /*
00155  * compare and order types
00156  */
00157 
00158 template<typename TYPE> inline
00159 int32_t strictly_order_type(const TYPE& lhs, const TYPE& rhs) {
00160     return (lhs < rhs) ? 1 : 0;
00161 }
00162 
00163 template<typename TYPE> inline
00164 int32_t compare_type(const TYPE& lhs, const TYPE& rhs) {
00165     return strictly_order_type(rhs, lhs) - strictly_order_type(lhs, rhs);
00166 }
00167 
00168 template<typename TYPE> inline
00169 bool equals_type(const TYPE& lhs, const TYPE& rhs) {
00170     return (lhs == rhs);
00171 }
00172 
00173 /*
00174  * create, destroy, copy and move types...
00175  */
00176 
00177 template<typename TYPE> inline
00178 void construct_type(TYPE* p, size_t n) {
00179     if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_ctor) {
00180         while (n--) {
00181             new(p++) TYPE;
00182         }
00183     }
00184 }
00185 
00186 template<typename TYPE> inline
00187 void destroy_type(TYPE* p, size_t n) {
00188     if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_dtor) {
00189         while (n--) {
00190             p->~TYPE();
00191             p++;
00192         }
00193     }
00194 }
00195 
00196 template<typename TYPE> inline
00197 void copy_type(TYPE* d, const TYPE* s, size_t n) {
00198     if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy) {
00199         while (n--) {
00200             new(d) TYPE(*s);
00201             d++, s++;
00202         }
00203     } else {
00204         memcpy(d, s, n*sizeof(TYPE));
00205     }
00206 }
00207 
00208 template<typename TYPE> inline
00209 void splat_type(TYPE* where, const TYPE* what, size_t n) {
00210     if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy) {
00211         while (n--) {
00212             new(where) TYPE(*what);
00213             where++;
00214         }
00215     } else {
00216         while (n--) {
00217             *where++ = *what;
00218         }
00219     }
00220 }
00221 
00222 template<typename TYPE> inline
00223 void move_forward_type(TYPE* d, const TYPE* s, size_t n = 1) {
00224     if ((traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_dtor && traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy)
00225             || traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_move) {
00226         memmove(d, s, n*sizeof(TYPE));
00227     } else {
00228         d += n;
00229         s += n;
00230         while (n--) {
00231             --d, --s;
00232             if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy) {
00233                 new(d) TYPE(*s);
00234             } else {
00235                 *d = *s;
00236             }
00237             if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_dtor) {
00238                 s->~TYPE();
00239             }
00240         }
00241     }
00242 }
00243 
00244 template<typename TYPE> inline
00245 void move_backward_type(TYPE* d, const TYPE* s, size_t n = 1) {
00246     if ((traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_dtor && traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy)
00247             || traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_move) {
00248         memmove(d, s, n*sizeof(TYPE));
00249     } else {
00250         while (n--) {
00251             if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_copy) {
00252                 new(d) TYPE(*s);
00253             } else {
00254                 *d = *s;
00255             }
00256             if (!traits<TYPE>::has_trivial_dtor) {
00257                 s->~TYPE();
00258             }
00259             d++, s++;
00260         }
00261     }
00262 }

00267 /*
00268  * a key/value pair
00269  */
00270 
00271 template <typename KEY, typename VALUE>
00272 struct key_value_pair_t {
00273     KEY     mKey;
00274     VALUE   mValue;
00275     key_value_pair_t() { }
00276     key_value_pair_t(const key_value_pair_t& o)
00277         : mKey(o.key), mValue(o.value) { }
00278     key_value_pair_t(const KEY& k, const VALUE& v) : mKey(k), mValue(v)  { }
00279     explicit key_value_pair_t(const KEY& k) : mKey(k) { }
00280     inline bool operator < (const key_value_pair_t& o) const {
00281         return strictly_order_type(mKey, o.mKey);
00282     }
00283 };
00284 
00285 template<>
00286 template <typename K, typename V>
00287 struct trait_trivial_ctor< key_value_pair_t<K, V> > {
00288     enum {
00289         value = aggregate_traits<K, V>::has_trivial_ctor
00290     };
00291 };
00292 
00293 template<>
00294 template <typename K, typename V>
00295 struct trait_trivial_dtor< key_value_pair_t<K, V> > {
00296     enum {
00297         value = aggregate_traits<K, V>::has_trivial_dtor
00298     };
00299 };
00300 
00301 template<>
00302 template <typename K, typename V>
00303 struct trait_trivial_copy< key_value_pair_t<K, V> > {
00304     enum {
00305         value = aggregate_traits<K, V>::has_trivial_copy
00306     };
00307 };
00308 
00309 template<>
00310 template <typename K, typename V>
00311 struct trait_trivial_move< key_value_pair_t<K, V> > {
00312     enum {
00313         value = aggregate_traits<K, V>::has_trivial_move
00314     };
00315 };
